claims.claim: Global private investment in fusion energy exceeds $9.7 billion across approximately 50 projects

ITER first plasma delayed to 2033 (from original 2025 target), with D-T operations now expected in 2039

NIF achieved record Q-factor of 4.13, producing 8.6 MJ from 2.08 MJ laser energy
NIF has achieved ignition seven times since December 2022 breakthrough
China's EAST tokamak achieved 1,066 seconds of H-mode plasma at 100 million degrees Celsius on January 20, 2025
EAST previous record was 403 seconds, set in 2023
CFS/MIT achieved 20 tesla magnetic field strength with HTS magnets in September 2021 - described as most important fusion development in 30 years
CFS successfully tested Central Solenoid Model Coil in November 2024, validating both HTS magnet types needed for SPARC
CFS plans SPARC first plasma in 2026, with ARC power plant delivering grid power in early 2030s
Helion signed world's first fusion PPA with Microsoft in May 2023 for 50 MW by 2028
Helion began construction of Orion plant in Chelan County, Washington in July 2025
Google signed 200 MW power purchase agreement with CFS for ARC plant
DOE Fusion Energy Strategy 2024 targets demonstrating pilot fusion plant in the 2030s via public-private partnership

ITER involves 33 nations collaborating on world's largest tokamak
ITER thermal shields have defects requiring removal and replacement of approximately 20-23 km of cooling pipes
NIF requires 400 MJ to power full facility while producing 3.15 MJ fusion output - still far from practical energy production
Highest tokamak Q-factor remains JET's Q=0.67 from 1997; no tokamak has achieved net energy gain
TAE Technologies has raised $1.2 billion with ~$5 billion valuation, partnering with Google for AI/engineering
